Aron Ralston.Action: Drives alone at night into a remote desert area with minimal lighting and potential hazards, showing confidence and preparedness for solitude and challenge.
Continues driving despite a caution sign indicating roads may be impassable due to storms, suggesting possible risk-taking or underestimation of danger.
Navigates difficult terrain at night, notices and reverses to a small sign to avoid missing the road spur to Horseshoe and Blue John Canyons.
Locks down and braces his bike solidly in the truck to prevent damage during rough driving.
Drives to a trailhead despite signs prohibiting camping and finds other vehicles and encampments there.
Turns off music and waits for signs of other people before settling down to sleep.
Wears a Phish tee shirt and rides energetically through the desert, showing passion for extreme sports and nature.
Passes other bikers without interaction, focused on his own ride.
Wears appropriate gear and carries hydration equipment for desert biking.
Pushes himself physically uphill despite exhaustion, showing determination and fitness.
Exhilarated and confident in challenging nature alone, demonstrating skill and daring.
Crashes over the handlebars into sand due to hitting a sand trap.
Approaches two girls hiking alone, introduces himself with a big smile and offers a handshake.
Asks to join the girls for a while despite being a stranger.
The girls do not respond to his initial request, but Aron persists politely.
Quickly assesses his situation after falling and trapped by the bike, takes a self-portrait photo of the incident.
Secures his bike with a U-lock in the shade and pockets the keys before heading off into the desert.
Approaches two hikers and confidently initiates conversation, introducing himself and asking to join them.
Despite initial lack of response from the girls, he maintains a positive attitude and friendly demeanor.
Jokes with the girls, laughs with them, and engages in friendly conversation despite being a lone hiker.
Apologizes when Megan expresses discomfort about him sneaking up on them.
Acknowledges the girls' nervousness and explains his situation openly.
Teases the girls playfully about their reaction to him wearing a hockey mask.
Offers helpful information about the climb and encourages the girls to climb with him.
Talks continuously and enthusiastically while climbing, showing openness and a desire to share his experience.
Encourages others to take risks and join him in a challenging climb, creating a playful and trusting atmosphere.
Sings loudly and joyfully in the cave to reassure others after his jump.
Leads the group by going first on a risky climb, demonstrating confidence and willingness to take calculated risks.
Encourages others and maintains a positive, playful attitude even in challenging situations.
Strips down to underwear to navigate difficult terrain, showing physical preparedness and adaptability.
Engages in lighthearted conversation with Megan and Kristi, sharing personal details about his relationships and climbing achievements in a friendly manner.
Responds to Megan's comment about the old house with a joking remark ('Just like a MOTEL 6 then?').
Explains his preference for solitude and singing loudly in the wilderness without negative judgment or defensiveness.
Has completed 46 of 59 winter solo ascents, demonstrating extensive experience and skill in challenging conditions.
Chooses to climb solo for solitude and personal enjoyment, indicating confidence and self-reliance.
Does not recognize the significance of the old cattle guardian's house spray-painted as 'MOTEL 6' and the strange smell, showing a possible oversight or lack of attention to environmental details.
Laughs at himself, admits that nobody likes him or his band, goofs around with others.
Gathers all packaging and stuffs it in his backpack, saying 'Leave no trace.'
Jokes with Kristi and Megan in a friendly, playful manner.
Gathers all their packaging and stuffs it in his backpack, saying 'Leave no trace.'
Negotiates a steep gulley skillfully, moving halfway down while others are at different points.
Admits he is not certified yet but wants to be, showing awareness of his current skill level and goals.
Jokes about being an illegal instructor and makes light comments during a serious activity.
Gives detailed climbing instructions to others, trying to help them navigate safely.
Offers to give Megan and Kristi a lift back to their car and invites them to a party with his friends.
Insists on continuing his climb despite others' concerns about getting out before dark.
Provides detailed, step-by-step climbing instructions confidently and clearly.
Offers to guide friends and shows knowledge of the map and route.
Insists on continuing a challenging climb despite warnings about darkness.
Uses a miner's lamp to mitigate risk of climbing in low light, showing preparedness.
Friends do not understand his instructions, indicating possible overestimation of their comprehension.
Invites friends to a party, provides clear directions, promises cold beers for when they meet up later.
Declines to hike out with friends, insists on sticking to his schedule despite their invitation.
Insists on continuing his solo hike despite friends inviting him to join them, showing determination and focus on his plan.
Checks his watch and picks up the pace to stay on schedule, demonstrating time management and self-discipline.
Recovers balance quickly after slipping on loose pebbles, preventing a fall.
Adjusts pace to be more cautious after slipping, showing awareness and adaptability.
Effortlessly selects and plays a CD from his pack while moving, demonstrating practiced skill and multitasking ability.
Scrambles down a difficult drop by clinging to the edge and dropping the final 6 feet, landing safely in a cloud of sand.
Easily scrambles over and around huge chockstones in a narrow canyon, showing agility and confidence.
Drinks deeply from his water bottle while navigating the canyon, indicating awareness of his physical needs and preparation.
Snaps a photo of the S-shaped log arching above him, documenting his route.
Mentions 'Won't be coming back this way,' showing decisiveness and awareness of his path.
Releases snagged rucksack strap to free himself when stuck under chockstone, remains calm without panic.
Uses climbing skills such as chimneying, body walking, and assessing natural body weight to navigate narrow canyon walls.
Kicks fiercely at a large chockstone to test its stability before stepping on it.
Instinctively lets go of the stone to avoid further injury.
Instinctively lets go of the stone when it starts to move dangerously, avoiding being pulled down with it.
Raises arms to protect his head and tries to compensate for injury by adjusting arm position during the rock fall.
Does not look where he is going while the chockstone falls towards him, resulting in injury.
Lands on his feet allowing the rock to jam his hand against the canyon wall, showing some control despite the accident.
Persistently struggles to free his hand despite extreme pain and exhaustion.
Expresses frustration and panic with repeated swearing and self-directed commands.
Attempts repeatedly to free his hand by using all his physical strength and different body parts, showing persistence and problem-solving under extreme stress.
Manages to shift the boulder fractionally despite intense pain, demonstrating physical capability and determination.
Wipes sweat away and carefully manages his water supply by drinking and backwashing, showing awareness and resource management.
Expresses panic and frustration vocally, which may indicate emotional overwhelm but does not prevent continued effort.
Calms himself down by telling himself to relax and stop, takes stock of his situation.
Calls out for help loudly despite knowing the remoteness of his location.
Switches off the music playing in his headphones to better focus on his situation.
Carefully caps the water bottle and puts it back in his pack after drinking, showing attention to preserving resources.
Takes deep breaths and consciously tries to relax and take stock of his situation, demonstrating self-control and situational awareness.
Checks his wristwatch repeatedly to confirm it is working, indicating methodical behavior and attention to detail.
Examines his trapped hand carefully, comparing sensation and size to his other hand, showing analytical thinking and assessment skills.
Expresses frustration and disbelief verbally about how he got trapped, which may indicate momentary emotional overwhelm.
Calls out for help repeatedly despite the canyon environment, showing persistence but possibly limited understanding of the situation's hopelessness.
Volunteers to take away the girls' chocolate muffin crumbs, showing consideration for others' belongings.
Focuses intently on his survival gear and actions with energy and purpose, showing self-reliance but little social interaction.
Unpacks all his gear systematically and tests each item for potential use, showing thoroughness and preparedness.
Begins to chip away at the rock with his knife, establishing a rhythm and maintaining energy and purpose despite injury.
Expresses frustration and despair when losing the knife and realizing the difficulty of his situation.
Attempts to use a rock and knife to chip away at the canyon wall despite difficulty and repeated failure.
Loses grip of the knife, which falls into a hole he cannot reach due to his restricted position.
Tries to use his foot to retrieve the knife by squeezing it into a hole, showing resourcefulness despite failure.
Expresses frustration and disbelief at his predicament, indicating emotional strain but continuing to try solutions.
Carefully lifts the knife out using his toes and hands, showing gentle and careful behavior.
Smiles and says 'Sweet' after successfully retrieving the knife, indicating a positive and sincere reaction.
Uses his headlamp placed above to illuminate the knife and carefully manipulates a stick to hook and lift the knife out, showing patience and dexterity.
Ties a shoelace to his wrist and loops it through the ring at the end of the multi-tool to prevent losing it, demonstrating foresight and resourcefulness.
Keeps blowing on his arm to keep it clear despite lips being caked with dust, showing persistence and attention to detail.
Shares a quiet moment with friend Mark Von Eeckhout, walking and observing the landscape together.
Carefully conserves water, showing self-discipline but no direct interaction with others.
Focuses on his own survival tasks, such as chipping rock and managing his equipment, without mention of others.
Carefully sips a tiny amount of water, conserving resources meticulously.
Uses a file to chip away at the rock, showing patience and skill in attempting to free himself.
Successfully catches a small chip of rock on his elbow, demonstrating good hand-eye coordination and focus.
Steps into his harness and attempts to throw rope with knots and carabiners to find purchase, showing technical knowledge and problem-solving.
Gently takes the weight off his feet as he is rescued, showing care for his own body after struggle.
Rubs at his legs unsteadily after regaining consciousness, does not express frustration or anger, just resumes chipping.
Observes the raven and the environment quietly, showing a calm and reflective demeanor.
Persists in throwing the rope, varying his approach each time until it catches.
Pulls gently at first, then fiercely, testing the rope's hold before descending carefully.
Stands unsteadily and rubs his legs after forced movement due to lack of circulation, but immediately resumes chipping without hesitation.
Freezes stock still watching the raven and the stillness around him, then switches off his light.
Keenly steps slightly ahead of others when crossing the line together, showing eagerness to participate in group activity.
Focuses camera attention on Rana, indicating admiration and appreciation for a friend.
Remains very still and focused on the rock and blade, showing introspection and self-reliance rather than social warmth.
Makes a video message providing his name and parents' names, and requests that whoever finds it contact his family.
Avoids looking at himself directly in the camera, appears alarmed and startled.
Carefully uses his shoe and sock to track the sunbeam's movement, showing patience and attention to detail.
Records a clear and detailed video message explaining his situation, including personal information and instructions for rescuers.
Avoids looking at himself directly in the camera, showing signs of emotional distress and possible lack of full emotional control.
Explains his dire situation clearly and honestly to the camera, showing transparency and a desire to communicate his reality to others.
Acknowledges the severity of his condition and the difficulty of his situation without dramatizing or blaming others.
Focuses on problem-solving and realistic assessment rather than despair or anger.
Mentions the possibility of self-amputation with sober reflection, showing acceptance rather than panic or self-pity.
Analyzes the situation carefully, noting the condition of his arm and the difficulty of moving the rock, showing clear observation and problem assessment.
Attempts multiple strategies to free himself, including rigging and chipping away at the rock, demonstrating persistence and practical problem-solving.
Acknowledges the limitations of his efforts and the severity of his situation, including the possibility of self-amputation, showing realistic self-awareness.
Expresses uncertainty about his ability to perform self-amputation and recognizes it as potentially suicidal, indicating cautiousness but also some hesitation.
Admits he didn't tell anyone where he was going and didn't leave a note on the truck, calling it 'Dumb.'
Screams repeatedly when hearing voices but then listens carefully and realizes the noise is not people, showing restraint and awareness.
Assesses the difficulty of climbing with one hand and realistically evaluates his chances of survival if he attempts to reach his vehicle.
Admits he did not tell anyone where he was going and did not leave a note on the truck.
Listens carefully to sounds in the canyon, distinguishes between human voices and animal noises, and adjusts his expectations accordingly.
Screams repeatedly when hearing voices but then stops to listen and analyze the situation calmly.
Screams desperately for help, showing vulnerability and a sincere plea for rescue.
Erases his futile calls for help after hearing his own desperation, indicating self-awareness but also isolation.
Laughs at his own ridiculous appearance inside the rope bag, showing self-awareness and a light-hearted attitude.
Frantically cannibalizes his belongings and uses his teeth to create makeshift clothing and insulation to survive the cold night.
Cannibalizes gear and clothing to create insulation and warmth, carefully using knife and teeth to avoid injury.
Paces frantically to generate heat and pass time, showing awareness of his physical and mental state.
Wraps himself in multiple layers of improvised insulation including ropes, bags, and webbing to protect against cold.
Laughs at his own appearance in the makeshift insulation, showing ability to maintain humor and morale.
Prays sincerely for guidance and help while trapped, showing vulnerability and openness.
Makes a darkly humorous comment about his situation, showing a coping mechanism that could connect with others.
Interacts briefly and politely with a coworker, exchanging friendly small talk.
Prays for guidance and openly admits he has tried everything he can think of, showing self-awareness and willingness to seek new ideas.
Switches on headlamp to illuminate his surroundings and carefully inspects his bag, demonstrating practical problem-solving behavior.
Appeals to the devil in desperation, offering his arm or soul to get out, indicating a moment of emotional vulnerability but also a clear focus on survival.
Experiences uncontrollable physical reactions (throat shuddering, teeth rattling) and acknowledges the grim humor, showing emotional resilience and self-awareness.
Leaves work without fully revealing himself, suggesting a reserved or cautious nature but no clear indication of competence or incompetence.
Carefully conserves water by drinking slowly and reburies the bottle to prevent evaporation.
Muttering curses at himself for tightening the bottle lid too much.
Uses a piece of cloth to improve grip and successfully opens a tightly sealed water bottle despite physical weakness and trembling hands.
Carefully conserves water by only taking a small sip and reburies the bottle to prevent evaporation.
Attempts to clean his contact lenses using moisture in his mouth, showing resourcefulness.
Muttering and cursing himself for overtightening the bottle lid, indicating frustration and a minor lapse in foresight.
Does not answer his mom's calls despite being present, closes the door on visitors.
Mom leaves a message expressing love and concern.
Closes the door when a girl and guy are in the apartment, indicating a desire for privacy or withdrawal.
Obsessively and inventively works on a crude lift and pulley to free himself, showing determination and self-reliance rather than social warmth.
Closes the door to have privacy despite others being in the apartment, indicating awareness of boundaries and focus.
Slips in contact lenses carefully, showing attention to detail and routine preparation.
Remains absolutely still and almost absent on the canyon floor, indicating a moment of passivity or shock.
Observes insects closely and clears them away from his hand, showing situational awareness and control.
Inventively recycles his insulation gear into a crude lift and pulley, demonstrating resourcefulness, inventiveness, and analytical skill.
Persistently tries to undo and tie knots with his teeth and hand, repeatedly looping and re-looping ropes, creating footholds and bouncing in them despite no immediate success.
Eventually stops and looks down as if about to cry, showing momentary emotional overwhelm.
Addresses the camera directly with honesty about his discomfort looking at himself.
Shares detailed observations about his environment and daily routine, including the raven and time checks.
Openly discusses his physical condition and bodily functions without embarrassment.
Attempts to create a 6:1 system to lift the boulder, showing knowledge of mechanical advantage and problem-solving skills.
Recognizes that friction between rope and carabiners dissipates force, indicating technical understanding.
Deliberately turns the video screen away from himself to avoid looking at himself, showing emotional self-awareness but possibly avoidance.
Keeps track of time and environmental details (raven flying overhead at exact time), demonstrating observational skills and mental discipline.
Considers drinking his own urine despite its foul smell, showing pragmatic survival thinking under extreme conditions.
Expresses frustration and self-consciousness about his situation (e.g., 'It's Monday - all day - bummer'), which may indicate emotional vulnerability but does not detract from competence.
Keeps himself occupied by chipping at the rock to generate warmth and maintain morale despite the futility.
Refers to his insect friends humorously about not being able to relieve himself, showing a lighthearted and friendly attitude.
Focuses on practical survival actions like making a tourniquet and attempting to cut off his arm, showing self-reliance but limited social warmth in this context.
Plans to chill water in the sand overnight to make it more drinkable.
Keeps track of sunlight duration and uses it to structure his routine.
Chips away at the rock to generate warmth and keep busy, despite knowing it might worsen the situation.
Recognizes that the rock chips are settling more on his arm and that his tourniquet is effective.
Constructs a tourniquet from neoprene tubing, tightening it carefully with multiple knots and securing it with a carabiner.
Expresses pride and sincere encouragement to his sister Sonja, acknowledging her achievements and who she is as a person.
Wraps a tourniquet tightly and methodically around his arm using knots and a carabiner, showing practical skill and knowledge.
Attempts to cut his trapped arm with a multi-tool but finds the blades too blunt, then switches blades and saws viciously, demonstrating persistence and adaptability despite limited tools.
Releases the tourniquet to check the damage and assesses the situation realistically, showing self-awareness and practical judgment.
Expresses frustration and self-criticism ('Pathetic, Aron, pathetic') after failing to cut through the arm, indicating a momentary lapse in confidence or self-doubt.
Analyzes the cause of failure (blunt blades, knock-off tool) and reflects on the situation calmly, showing intelligence and realistic appraisal.
Pauses to record a personal message to his sister, showing emotional awareness and presence of mind despite the crisis.
Thoughtfully reflects on his identity beyond his actions, showing self-awareness and vulnerability.
Mentions practical concerns about his family handling his affairs, showing consideration for others.
Speaks bitterly about the cold and harsh environment, expressing discomfort but not hostility.
Reflects thoughtfully on his identity and the relationship between actions and self, showing introspection and mental clarity.
Mentions logistical details about insurance, finances, and possessions, indicating practical thinking and preparation.
Struggles to complete his sentence and loses track of what he's saying, showing some cognitive or emotional strain.
Observes the environment carefully, noting the weather and changes in light, demonstrating situational awareness.
Tries to grab his possessions and push/pull to gain height underwater despite overwhelming water force.
Manages to switch on his light underwater in near-zero visibility conditions.
Remains alert and responsive after being submerged and freed from the chockstone underwater.
Watches and laughs at human sounds after days of silence, showing emotional vulnerability and connection to others.
Licks condensation inside the bag to hydrate, showing resourcefulness but no direct social warmth.
Swallows urine to survive, demonstrating self-preservation but no interpersonal warmth.
Says 'See you later...' to his water bottle, indicating a moment of personification and possible hope or tenderness.
Carefully licks condensation inside the bag to hydrate, showing resourcefulness and attention to detail.
Swallows urine carefully without disturbing sediment, demonstrating practical survival skills and composure under stress.
Stops the video camera and shuts it, indicating control over his environment and mental focus.
Laughs and stares with eyes tearing in self-pity, showing emotional vulnerability but not necessarily incompetence.
Searches for girls at the party, but is not acknowledged and does not react negatively.
Ritually checks water and carefully handles contact lenses despite frustration and physical discomfort.
Ritually checks water bottle to ensure he has not drunk all the water unknowingly.
Removes contact lenses and washes them in his mouth, showing practiced routine.
Carelessly leaves water bottle lid partially open, causing water to spill on his shorts.
Expresses frustration at himself for the careless mistake, indicating self-awareness.
Greets and acknowledges friends and family warmly in his video message, expressing love and appreciation for his parents sincerely.
Mentions drinking his own urine pragmatically without complaint, showing resilience but no particular warmth.
Keeps a detailed mental log of time, water consumption, and potential rescue timelines, showing awareness of his situation and planning.
Resorts to drinking his own urine after letting it distill, demonstrating resourcefulness and survival skills.
Acknowledges the risk of flash floods and the origin of the rock trapping him, showing understanding of environmental dangers.
Pauses and shudders at the idea of drinking urine, showing a moment of emotional or physical discomfort but then composes himself, indicating emotional regulation.
Records a video message to loved ones, showing presence of mind and emotional intelligence but also a recognition of possible fatal outcome.
Expresses love and regret to his mother sincerely.
Prepares methodically and speaks encouragingly to himself ('Ready for lift-off', 'Come on, move, dammit').
Focuses intensely on his survival task, showing determination but no direct social interaction.
Charges into setting up the 6:1 haul system again, much quicker this time, clearing the rope and possessions efficiently.
Applies a tourniquet on his arm carefully, securing it tightly with knots and a carabiner, showing knowledge of first aid.
Hesitates before plunging the knife into his arm but proceeds with a deliberate and controlled action, indicating mental preparation and resolve.
Stops and stares at the knife and his situation, showing a moment of stillness and possible hesitation or doubt.
Records a video message explaining his situation and warns viewers about graphic content, showing consideration for others' feelings.
Drinks all his water quickly and carefully manages his resources, showing self-care but limited social interaction.
Focuses intensely on self-surgery and survival without mention of others, indicating self-reliance but limited outward warmth in this moment.
Carefully assesses the wound by observing the layers of skin, fat, and muscle, and listens for the bone with the knife.
Drinks all remaining water quickly to stay hydrated and manages the tourniquet to control blood loss.
Attempts to saw through the bone with a small knife despite knowing it is not suitable for the task.
Documents his condition and actions on video, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Stops the video and uses his t-shirt to make an impromptu bandage to cover his wound, showing resourcefulness and self-care.
Holds his hand to his chest to calm his racing heart, indicating self-awareness and vulnerability.
Mentions missing the raven's flight and being late, showing a sense of connection to his environment and a reflective nature.
Stops the video and improvises a bandage from his t-shirt to cover the wound, tying it with his teeth.
Holds his hand to his chest to calm his racing heart, showing awareness of his physical state.
Notes that he is out of water and acknowledges his dire situation.
Expresses frustration about missing the raven and being late, indicating distraction or emotional distress.
Says 'Thanks' to a figure who puts a huge rock on his side and leaves.
Carries on despite pain and discomfort ('owwww!') without complaint or giving up.
No explicit interaction with others beyond brief thanks; mostly focused on self and survival.
Carries on despite pain and discomfort ('owwww!' but he carries on).
Uses a small fire to comfort himself in harsh conditions.
Shivers violently from cold, indicating physical vulnerability but continues effort.
Acknowledges that he didn't enjoy people's company as much as he could have and tends to ignore or dismiss their presence.
Thanks Tom for the lovely, natural fire last night.
Reflects on his social interactions and acknowledges that he often ignores or dismisses the presence of good people around him.
Appears disoriented and incoherent at times, rambling on video and reacting strongly to unpleasant stimuli like the stench of sediment.
Reflects on not appreciating the presence of good people around him, acknowledging he tends to ignore or dismiss them.

Attempts to communicate or get help by knocking on door and using light, showing effort to connect and seek assistance.

Mentions slowing down and heart rate pounding, indicating awareness of his physical state.
Asks for help and expresses a sincere desire to endure without harming himself.
Speaks to himself with honesty about his dire situation and vulnerability.
Acknowledges his dire situation clearly, asks for strength to endure without self-harm, and expresses determination to see it through.

Imagines playing and bonding warmly with a little boy who looks like him, showing tenderness and affection.

Expresses fear and uncertainty about dying, revealing vulnerability and honesty.
Blames himself for the accident, showing acceptance of responsibility.

Acknowledges his dehydration and physical deterioration honestly, indicating self-awareness.
Expresses uncertainty and admits he doesn't know what to do, revealing vulnerability and possible lack of immediate solutions.
Reflects on personal responsibility for his predicament, showing insight and acceptance rather than denial.

Expresses intense anger and frustration toward the canyon and the rock trapping him.
Chose not to tell anyone where he was going, despite warnings and opportunities to do so.
Uses available resources (sock, shoe, knife, hammer rock) creatively to try to free himself despite pain and injury.
Continues to hammer at the rock despite swelling, pain, and fatigue, showing persistence and problem-solving under extreme conditions.
Expresses intense anger and frustration which could cloud judgment but also fuels his efforts to escape.
Speaks to himself calmly and clearly, encouraging himself to 'Get rid of it Aron, it's dead, it's garbage.'
Endures intense pain silently without complaint or outward expression of anger or frustration.
Focuses intensely on self-rescue with no indication of bitterness or self-pity.
Uses his knife to carefully probe and puncture the gangrenous flesh, recognizing the danger and deciding to remove the dead tissue.
Applies intense physical effort to break his own bones in order to free his trapped arm, showing determination and understanding of his body's mechanics.
Remains silent and focused despite extreme pain and the grotesque nature of his actions, maintaining control and composure.
Silently endures extreme pain and focuses on self-rescue without complaint or seeking help.

Maintains focus and silence despite extreme pain, showing mental discipline and determination.
Uses a tourniquet effectively to control bleeding after initial cutting.
Swaps tools (knife to pliers) when the knife is ineffective, adapting his approach.
Endures extreme pain silently and focuses on self-rescue without complaint.
Perseveres through extreme pain to continue self-surgery, carefully identifying and cutting the nerve and tendon despite intense physical and mental trauma.
Pauses and questions himself 'Can you do this?' showing momentary doubt but ultimately proceeds with the difficult task.
Spits out a defiant declaration 'I AM NOT GOING TO DIE.... HERE.' showing determination and self-encouragement.
Carefully packages his severed arm and takes photos as a farewell gesture.
Prepares his gear meticulously and sets off alone down the canyon after self-amputation.
Packages his amputated arm carefully using available materials and secures it in a makeshift sling.
Packs essential survival items including water, urine, video, pocket knife, and climbing rope before moving on.
Hesitates briefly but takes photos of the rock and his hand as a form of farewell.
Staggers and shows physical weakness immediately after freeing himself, indicating physical limits.
Kisses the bolts like the pope arriving in a foreign land, showing reverence and gratitude for the means of survival.
Pushes forward despite pain and injury, focused on survival rather than seeking help or connection with others.
Continues climbing despite pain in his right shoulder, showing persistence and physical endurance.
Follows the rope carefully, managing its progress and knots meticulously despite harsh conditions.
Stops to carefully undo every knot in the rope before proceeding, demonstrating attention to detail and methodical behavior.
Wobbles and nearly lunges over the precipice but stops himself, showing self-awareness and control under extreme stress.
Cares for himself by drinking and washing despite difficult conditions, showing self-preservation and practical concern.
Catches the rope just in time as it uncoils over the ledge, preventing loss of his lifeline.
Inches over a difficult overhang with only one useful arm, showing skill and determination despite vulnerability.
Executes a controlled descent into a shallow pool despite his injured state, demonstrating climbing expertise and presence of mind.
Drinks and washes with contaminated water containing insects, leaves, and tadpoles, risking infection or illness.
Uses his map to plot a route out after reaching the pool, showing planning and situational awareness.
Salutes the ancient figures painted on the canyon wall in his own way before continuing his journey.
Calls out desperately for help when he sees distant figures, showing vulnerability and hope for connection.
Murmurs encouragement to himself to keep going despite exhaustion and isolation.

Keeps to the shadows to avoid heat and possibly conserve energy.
Attempts to call for help despite initial hesitation and weak voice.
Shows emotional vulnerability by nearly crying but uses self-talk to encourage himself.
Clearly communicates his dire situation and need for help to strangers.
Accepts water and food gratefully from the Mejers.

Asks rescuers practical questions about communication and medical help, shows concern for his condition.

Slumps forward and becomes motionless, barely responding to others.

Expresses gentle recognition and affection toward his mother.

Maintains composure and interacts gently with his mother after recovery.
